Son didn't finish his but I did warn him before he ordered the biscuits n gravy MEAL. He cleared the biscuits and gravy (the best part) and most of the bacon, eggs and hash browns that were left.   Overall this place was great. If I am ever in the area I will absolutely come here again. Heck, I may make a weekend trip just for kicks! You won't be disappointed.
The menu has a lot of potential but the breakfast isn't that great.. Eggs are overcooked, pancakes are tough to eat, and the butter was nearly frozen.

Will never go back. The most depressing place on earth. They have nursing and funeral home advertisements on the table. Decor and ambience just killed it for me. Food was bland and not exciting. Couldn't wait to get out.

I had the steak and eggs again, it did not disappoint. My youngest ordered the kids silver dollar pancake breakfast. It was enormous. His hot chocolate was large with whipped cream piled nice and high. Their lunch menu looks excellent as well, so I plan on trying that soon as well. We have always had excellent and attentive service here. They have plenty of parking in the back. It's right across from St. Joes, so this is greatly convenient for us.

We decided to try this place out for breakfast. I love it! The wait staff was prompt and friendly. The food arrived quickly and was delicious. The restaurant is clean and inviting. I liked everything about it and I will definitely be back when I'm in the downtown area.

For your basic breakfast, this place is great.  The prices are so cheap, you get a very large amount of food, and the food was really good for what we ordered.  No fancy breakfast options (benedict, etc) but delicious basic breakfast.  Service was great and we were seated right away.  I love the diner atmosphere.

My son and I came in for breakfast.  Our first visit definitely won't be our last.  Food was great!  Son had Pumpkin waffle and I had the Mediterranean Omelet.  Both were great!  Can't wait to bring my wife
Very friendly staff and clientele.  This is where the charismatic come for breakfast.  The cowboy scramble is filling and tasty.

Kitchen seems to really hold up speed of service.  Additionaly, service staff seem overwhelmed by a normal busy breakfast shift. Late giving menus,  slow to ask for your drink order etc.  The food is of good quality. Menu is as expected for a corner diner. But dang, the service is off putting!

I have been here a coupe of times and always remember too late that they have no Wi-Fi and nothing on the tv. No sriracha, just Tabasco, cholula and tapatio. Apparently they "can't" make a half sandwich? Really good potatoes though.
Tried this cafe on a whim & it was delicious. Service was quick and friendly. This cafe had a neighborly vibe to it. We will definitely return.
Love this place; always accommodating, and they remember their regulars, which is nice..even when I haven't been for awhile!

Came here when I was super duper sick, so I tried to get in and out real quick -- I got a lot of assistance from various people at the bar when I was getting my to go order. I'll make sure to check back when I get a chance to sit down and eat here -- My "coyboy scramble" was really tasty, and the coffee was okay. Would definitely come back.

The moment I walked in I felt the love, man, I felt the love. This cute old lady waved at me and we found our seats. The service was fast and the food was good. The servers are soooo nice and if you check in you get a FREE HIGH FIVE! Hahaha
Had the morning glory omelette. Too many raw veggies. Kinda hard to eat an omelette crunching thru onions.
Delicious inexpensive food. I was in the neighborhood and was looking at a brunch place to eat. I found this and I will be coming back! Delicious, Tasty, cheap dining.

The perfect breakfast diner!  God I love this place.  Big portions of GREAT breakfast food in a CLASSIC diner setting.  The hasbrowns were greasy and awesome, pancakes and scrambled eggs were done PERFECTLY!    They have a bar and booth seating as well, and the place was filled with the sounds of the sizzling grill.  What a great place!

I went to 5th Avenue Cafe today ready to have some brunch (well breakfast food really). I absolutely love breakfast. Aside from ice cream, it's my favorite.   The atmosphere was okay. We were at a huge table off to the side due to the large number of people in our party. I quickly noticed that the fans in the building did not cover the one half of our table. We had to fan ourselves with items we could find at the table. We were asked if we wanted separate checks, which was a nice bonus with a large table.  I ended up ordering an omelet, hash browns, and rye toast. The hash browns and the omelet were a little drier than I would've hoped for. I don't like greasetastrophes, but I do like a little flavor. It was, however, a large portion of food, and I ended up only being able to finish half of it.  It wasn't bad to the point that I won't ever go back again, but I'm not sure it will be on my list of places to visit in a hurry.

I just have to say that the owner of this place definitely knows how to run a restaurant and how to take care of customers! She treats everyone there like she's known them for years!   I've been here a couple times and every time it has been quite good until today. Today, she came around to ask if everything was okay and I told her with some hesitation that my meal wasn't so great. She was so kind and remedied the entire situation for me. She told me she valued what I said and was going to make sure she fixed the problem for next time.   This is truly a neighborhood restaurant. I love that I can walk here from home and get such wonderful food and service. Yes, they are really busy on the weekends but the servers are clearly working SO hard to do everything they can to take care of diners!   Even though today wasn't the best meal, I still think this place deserves 5 stars because they take such great pride in making sure everything is done right and they take each customers opinion to heart.   I will definitely be back :)

This place is always busy and deservingly so.  The food is delicious, the service is great,  and they have very reasonable prices! I've tried most of their breakfast foods and even their sandwiches,  soups,  and pasta and everything has always been delicious. The place is never dirty or unkempt. I have a very fussy 2 year old and the same nice lady now recognizes us when we come in and gives him crackers to keep him busy until our food comes,  which is never a long time. This will remain one of our favorite IHOP alternatives since we love supporting local businesses!
5th Ave is my favorite breakfast place in the downtown/central Phoenix area. The place is always full but I've never had to wait to be seated. Great service with a cozy, cafe ambiance.

We found this place close to our Airbnb house and decided to give it a try.  It is across the street from a hospital so I was a little skeptic. Outside looks like a pretty normal restaurant, but once we walked inside I realized we had made the right choice. It is darker inside and have the feeling of an old town diner where locals can grab a quick bite or linger for drinks and laughs. We were greeted quickly and were immediately served with drinks. My companions chose a BLT and the other wanted the Philly Steak.  I chose the special which was a Southwest spicy pasta. All portions were generous meaning two people could share. The only reason I gave one less star is because my pasta was a little limp, but the sauce put the bravo on the dish. Don't forget to get the Yelp High Five when you check in. This delicious lunch gave us enough energy to climb South Mountain.

Cozy atmosphere.  The cafe seems to have two personalities: one side felt like a diner, and the other was a little more inviting (booths).  Felt like a regular even though it was my first visit (months ago).  Ordered the strawberries 'n creme crepe sans powdered sugar... very good!  Wouldn't mind coming back to try other menu items.

This place does basic food well. Big portions.  There is a good variety of food. Very well priced. Many breakfast items for under 8.00. I had the Cowboy scramble. The pancakes my son had look really good.will be back. 3.5 stars is what I rate my meal at this time.

I liked this place as soon as we walked in. It was homey and everyone was very friendly and welcoming. We had brunch and the food came out quickly, was fresh and delicious. The pancakes were a must and the coffee was good as well. The prices are welcome compared to most of the lunch places I frequent in the area. I will definitely be back soon!

Dawn is such a sweetheart!  I walked in, plopped down at the bar and she looked at me. "Coffee. You need coffee!" I don't know if it was love at first sight, but she gets me!  Anthony later stopped by and introduced himself with a handshake and glass of water.  These people know how to make you feel welcome!  I ordered the chicken fried steak and eggs. I was very happy! Everything was delicious and I left full, recharged and stoked that I got to enjoy a breakfast that made me feel like I had been a regular for years.

First off, this is a Diner, not a cafe. Second, im not sure how this gets an average of 4 stars on yelp..  Went in, dark and dingy, which I never hold against a place, sometimes theyre the best plces to eat, but that did not apply here.   Sat at the counter, had a nice waitress, while the other two did not seem like they wanted to be there at all or didnt know what they were doing.   Ordered bacon and swiss omelette with hash browns and wheat toast. Omlette: subpar. Bacon wasnt cooked enough, nor was there really much in there, same with the cheese, not cheesy at all. Cooked fine though. The hash browns were cooked in enough butter, but learn to season with salt and pepper.  One of the most basic things as a cook is to season your food.    Look, this place isn't worth stopping at for food.

This is the best place in town for comfort food and comfort atmosphere.  The owners, Dawn and Earl are the best.  You are welcomed like you have gone to their home.  The servers are super friendly and want to make sure you are well taken care.  Its like going to a friends house.  The food is very good.  It is not a gourmet dining experience.  Its not meant to be.  What its meant to be is well prepared comfort food, good service and a friendly welcoming attitude.  It totally succeeds.  My eggs are always perfectly cooked, my hash nice and crispy and they always crisp my hash browns perfectly for me.  Their hamburgers are really good.  I particularly like their BLT.  Its loaded with bacon and the tomatoes are always ripe and juicy.  Their rotating lunch dishes are just like mama made. Their Saturday and Sunday brunch specials are very good.  The prices are reasonable and compare very well with other places in the area. To make a long story short I love the place and go there every chance I get.

Here from California for spring training and found this great cafe thanks to yelp! Very afforable breakfast , great food and great customer service.    We called last min for a party of 8 and they were able to accommodate. Really recommend this place!!

I'm kinda pissed no-one told me about this place earlier...   yeah its a dive, no... its not purrrrrdy... but wow... nice breakfast for 2 under $13.00!. Being from the east coast, I know you can't judge a book by its cover... so no judgements were made walking in... Honestly ... outside of the Roscoe's Baseball team... the patrons nor the restaurant has changed in 30+ years.. ( clothing or fixtures )   The service was pleasant, and decent... large classic plastic glasses that hold the beverages are a good value and no need to ever ask for a refill.   I had a typical breakfast.. eggs over, hash browns, link sausage and wheat toast. All arrived hot and flavorful... the sausage, regardless of ingredients... was the best I've ever had in Arizona... I will be back just for them!!   I noticed a full bar, and although I didn't ask, I can imagine that I could come here for a raging drink fest and not pay much... I hope that at night the bartender is an old, surly woman slamming the drinks down for me... that would make it picture perfect!
It's very cheap and delicious! It's very hidden and windows are tinted, it's hard to tell if it's open. I found it on Google Maps for searching for breakfast. 10/10 would recommend!
Lovely historic neighborhood breakfast joint. Really friendly staff, quick service, inexpensive, classic diner. Can't wait to go back!

Long story short: pretty darn good place for breakfast with bold Southwestern flavors.  Long story long:  After checking out of our hotel in Phoenix, we had arranged to have breakfast with a friend of mine whom I know via Twitter.  She had gotten off work pretty late the night prior, otherwise we probably would have hung out then, so we opted for breakfast.  I had seen this place and a couple of other ones, and cross referenced her suggestions.  I was leaning toward this place because it was relatively near the 17 going up to Flagstaff, since I wanted to get on the road as soon as possible because we had a long day of driving ahead of us.  I almost drove right by this place.  Not that its impossible to find, I just almost missed it like that.  Walking in, my friend was already waiting for us in a booth.  The place definitely has a little bit of a Southwest feel to it.  Pretty spacious with plenty of seating and it smelled good, which is always a good sign.  Looking at their menu, they had a lot of your typical breakfast cafe type of dishes, but quite a few of them with a Southwest flair.  I eventually decided on the Chorizo Cowboy, a scramble with chorizo, hash browns, and cheddar cheese.  Served with a side of salsa and toast.  I got an orange juice to drink.  Our food came out and it looked and smelled good.  How can you go wrong with chorizo?  And eggs?  And hash browns?  And cheese?  You just can't.  Don't argue with.. nop.. shush!!!  I put some salsa on it and dug in.  Talk about good flavor.  Everything worked well with each other.  I could taste the spices from the chorizo and it was all good.  I will say though there was a tiny bit of a grease puddle on the bottom when I was done, but hey, fat is flavor, hahaha.  Still good though.  We left full, but not stuffed, and satisfied.  Prices were reasonable as well.  I would definitely come back here should I ever find myself in Phoenix.  Hey, you never know ;)

My cousin suggested we meet at this place for lunch since I was driving from Tucson to LA. I ordered a grilled cheese with tomato and half of it was just toast and a tomato slice. Essentially I paid $5.45 for toast and fries. Bonus star because it was cheap.

My dad and I stop in for breakfast this morning.  I loved all the musical instruments hanging on the wall and the pictures.  Also enjoyed seeing so many locals and many 90 plus year olds.  We sat ourselves and were greeted immediately by the one and only waitress, Paula.  The place was packed.  They have hot green tea and the food was better than Matt's Big Breakfast.  They have an awesome wood counter and wooden chairs plus the tables with the booths have been finished nicely.  My dad had the veggie cowboy with rye toast and instead of potatoes a side of fruit and we were not charged for the substitution.  I elected to have the pancakes and two eggs as I am searching AZ for the best pancakes.  These were okay nothing to rave about but the fact they were better than Matts big breakfast.  When eating pancakes, if I can cut them with just my fork and they taste good with just butter they are great.  These needed to be cut with a knife and they were on a little bit dry.  Great service and great decor.  If we lived closer we would come again.

5th Avenue Cafe is a wonderful neighborhood friendly Cafe. I walk to this location and enjoy the coffee and entree for breakfast. I've never eaten lunch here.  The menu is classic diner, whether it be chicken fried steak, egg sandwiches, corn beef and hash. Egg white Greek omelet and etc, they always come thru with expectations.   The staff is super friendly and on top of the coffee top off. I'll continue to frequent this establishment and recommend to anyone.

Wow! This place is top of the line. Delicious food. Amazing owner. Dawn welcomed us into her restaurant and made us feel like we were at home. Food was yummy. I really enjoyed my experience at 5th Avenue Cafe and I'll be back ASAP. Highly recommend!

"Greasy spoons" are called such for a reason, but when you have a pool of that yellow margarine stuff under your hash brown, it's too much.  The biscuits and gravy were no better than the ones at Whataburger, and the eggs are definitely not fresh eggs.  But the biggest letdown of all was the coffee, which was several hours old. I've had baths hotter than this.  The only saving grace was the very pleasant and attentive servers, who (bless them) kept offering coffee refills.

My boyfriend and I were searching for brunch at 11am on a Sunday. Happened upon 5th avenue through Yelp and weren't disappointed. The place doesn't look like much from the outside, but inside was nicer.  Food came out fast and was quite delicious (Belgian waffle with strawberries, Cowboy chorizo). We also had a spicy, tasty, Bloody Mary. Service was quick and friendly.  One star off for pricing. I understand it's a brunch place and they make a profit off breakfast fare, but the pricing was super inconsistent. Waffle was pretty small for ~$8, yet the Bloody Mary was huge and delicious for just $5.

We dined there today after looking at the reviews on yelp however I was not impressed!  I ordered an omelette at the Servers suggestion, when I received it, it was not fully cooked. I flagged down my server and ask to have it recooked. When it was returned it was missing the orange slice  which was there when they took it away and it was still not done.  besides all that I found a hair in my cottage cheese. The other two people I was with were happy with their meals so that's why I gave it three stars.  Prices are reasonable as it's not a very expensive place to dine if you're looking for something quick and easy.

Great local spot for breakfast.  The servers were very attentive and make sure the coffee cup was filled.  The food was served quickly, delicious and priced well.  It has the feel of a local establishment, neighborly with a steady cliental coming through the door the 90 minutes we were there for a breakfast meeting.   Places like this are too often replaced by chains and franchises.  This spot reminded me of ol fashioned diner or perhaps Scott's Generations or Good Egg where the servers often seemed to recognize a customer, nice breakfast, pleasant atmosphere and efficient service.

Excellent experience. Had the French toast and eggs with side of 2 bacon slices. The service was great and the food came out quickly, the noise level at 10:00 a.m. was really good even though the restaurant was located on a fairly busy road and the prices are reasonable. The only thing that wasn't good was the coffee. Maybe make it just a little bit stronger or invest a few more on decent beans. Would come back and try other items on the menu.

My family and I popped in for brunch and I was pleasantly surprised. It is a lovely little cafe with friendly but quick service, delicious and very affordable meals, and quaint seating. The menu ranges from standard breakfast foods (I.e. omelets, scrambles, and waffles) to lunch and dinner foods that made me want to come back later for seconds. The booths are small, but comfortable for a party of four and there are tables for slightly bigger groups. One of the owners stopped by our table and refreshed our coffee and told us a little history of the cafe which was nice. Overall, I truly enjoyed my experience and would highly recommend.

Adorable cafe with delicious food and friendly staff.   The staff is always very nice and quick with bringing out food and refills. The food is always yummy and never a let down.  Dawn and her staff always go the extra mile to make our dining experience delightful.   I highly recommend you visit 5th Avenue Cafe.
Great service. Timely and friendly place. Good prices for breakfast for down towny area. Not a fancy place but not a dump either. Go there!

Suprised that I've lived in Phoenix so long and hadn't discoverd 5th Avenue Cafe.  Thank you Yelp for giving me the tip on my smartphone.  There are freakin' few breakfast restaurants, except trendy expensive places, that serve alcohol.  Being the day after Christmas a Bailey's 'n coffee sounded pretty good.  No problem.  While my brain pointed me toward a lighter side, I ended up with their corned beef hash, which I'm pretty sure is made on premises.  I topped that with a couple of poached eggs (I almost expected them to tell me no-way, but they cheerfully took the order).  Not being the biggest potato fan I opted for fresh fruit, which was more than adequete.  An order of raisin toast rounded out the meal.  1) Price - superb. didn't see anything over $10 2) Food quality - a few notches above average and way above fast food chains 3) Service - GREAT!  Only thing is they seem to throw multiple servers at you 4) Ambience - pretty cool.  Kind of a musical theme. 5) Clientele - mostly older vets it seems.  Nice guys. 6). Value - For me (a light eater) it was perfect, but the portions are a bit on the small side.  This is one place I will be back.  For breakfast and for lunch.  It's just a good feeling place, and there are so few of them left.

My favorite go to place for breakfast & lunch!  Everything on the menu is delicious,  good home cooked comfort food.  My hubby introduced me to this place about 10 years ago and I/we are regulars.  Customers are always welcomed with a greeting & a smile.  Service is great!  Wonderful place to have a quick business lunch or leisurely meal with a friend,  while service is quick, you never feel rushed.  The owners,  Dawn & Earl,  make time to know their customers & check in with all.  Balthazar usually has my iced tea at my table as soon as I sit down and Gabby, Crystal,  Jesse & Paula take excellent care of us.  LOVE THIS PLACE!

I Love the old time bar feeling this place has. The food was awesome, I haven't had a burger that good in a long time! It's large and Juicy, and the toppings bar let me make it just the way I like. The staff seemed to be slightly less than happy to be there, but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and think maybe they weren't having the best day. The place was clean, and although the Freestyle Coke machine was down, there was a regular fountain drink machine made available so we could still enjoy a cold drink with our burgers.   I'd say we'll probably be back. It's a drive for us from Peoria, but when we're in the area we'll stop in again.

This is one of those 3.5 star restaurants but since it is close to downtown and actually has a parkinglot in the back, I'll bump it up to four.  The food was pretty good.  I had ordered the biscuits and gravy.  Mind you, they weren't as good as Breakfast Joynt's but it was pretty solid.  The biscuits tasted fresh and were not hard.  The gravy could have used more pepper and sausage in it but I resolved the pepper situation and the giant sausage patties that came with my meal helped solve the other situation.  I came out of here full and happy.  The price is right and the place is full of a great mix of different people.  Really a good place to people watch.  I will most likely come back.

I love 5th Avenue Café, starting with the friendly staff. Chances are you'll be warmly greeted by Dawn, one half of the husband and wife ownership team. Then a parade of servers will make sure your order is promptly taken, your coffee and water promptly refilled and your dishes promptly cleared.  The location is good, especially convenient for anyone working or visiting St. Joseph's hospital right across the street. It's also historical. The restaurant originally operated as Upton's (established 1955), a well known dining spot for politicians and celebrities back in the day.  The food is great. Breakfast and lunch. One in our party this day mentioned that the Top of the Morning Omelette was the best omelette she had eaten in ages. The pancakes are light and fluffy. The coffee is served black and hot. Unique requests are happily honored. Specials are posted on a chalk board behind the counter. Mimosas available!  The ambiance is that of a simple diner. Not trendy. Not industrial. Not mid-century modern. It's comfy. The 5th Avenue Café is a locally owned neighborhood restaurant that serves classic comfort food. Expect friendly people, advertisements embedded in the tables and delicious food.

AMAZING place for weekend brunch! The food is great and the service is incredible. Everyone is so friendly and I love coming here. I definitely recommend everything on the menu and make sure to add a mimosa, too.
Best place fur breakfast and lunch! Friendly staff and portions are pretty big. So tasty. I'm very happy with this gem! Gotta come in and eat. They close @ 2 though so get here early.

Good hangover food! Inexpensive, a little greasy, but tastes pretty good.  I enjoyed the omelet but did not care for the toast, which seemed a little stale.  My wife's bagel and egg sandwich was also really good and very inexpensive.  The service was not great. It took a long time to get our order taken.  When the food came out, my omelet was missing an ingredient.  Instead of fixing it, they simply added it in a container on the side.  Um, I wanted an omelet, not fondue.  For service, they loose a star.  Overall, not bad, not amazing, but by far the best breakfast place within a couple blocks of Thomas and Central.

I just left the cafe and feeling good about it.  Good basic breakfast food.  I got an English muffin ham sandwich, which was good. It came with hash browns, to greasy, but over all a good meal. 3 people, $18.00... Ya get what you pay for.  And one more thing, there is beer.  :)

Breakfast is good. Liked the staff.  The coffee is horrible. Like swamp water and zero taste. Also, they don't filter There drinking water. Two very simple things to fix to earn this place another star...

Been coming here for a few years now, always a great place to come to if you don't know what you feel like eating....and for good simple french toast! Most of all love the prices--cheap good food.  Breakfast here is awesome:)

Have visited this place many times, the feel is nice and the staff are great. This time I got the "mile high"... I'm sorry but in wasn't impressed. The bacon was warm at best, $2.50 to sub potatos intead of hashbrowns and they weren't hot at all. I still love this place but I will stick to skillets.. they are hot all the time.

It took me a long time to try 5th Ave Cafe despite the fact that it's near my house...why? It just doesn't look that great from outside. I finally went, and I was glad I gave it a chance. The breakfast menu is large and varied (oh and very affordable, which is great!). There aren't any options on their menu that are super 'special' or 'different,' but this is a diner, so that wasn't expected. I tried their grits (they were fairly tasty), pumpkin pancakes (pretty yummy), egg sandwich on an english muffin (probably could make this at home, but the egg was cooked correctly, which I appreciate), and the chicken fried steak (can't comment.... I don't typically like chicken fried steak anywhere). This place is a no frills diner and I'd definitely return if I felt like that kind of breakfast.

Do not go here! The food is very bland and tasteless. We were waiting for a long time for our food to arrive and the table next to us that got there after us got their food first. There are funeral and nursing home advertisements all over the tables and it's very depressing environment.

Horrible place... I ordered 2 egg breakfast with bacon! The bacon that was served to me was rotten, smelly and slimy... I told the waiter and he asked if I wanted something different I said know I was grossed out and he apologized and gave me a 10% discount on bill.   Very disgusting and disappointed. Stay away or you'll get salmonella poisoning!! I wish I could give them negative stars!
The pork chop and eggs special was delicious!!! Great idea Dawn. You're on the cutting edge of breakfast specials. I can only image what masterpiece you might create with something like meatloaf.
Very nice and laid back place. The food was great. I gave it 4 stars because I asked for no bell peppers and they gave me bell peppers. Staff is awesome

This is the type of breakfast diner I find most appealing. It has a family-run type of feel to it with excellent food that beats the price of most other breakfast restaurants. I could tell this is a well-loved eatery when I showed up and almost every single table and booth was taken at 9AM. I had the chorizo cowboy skillet and I was in heaven!! I couldn't ask for anything better. The service was also excellent.

I loved this kick back mellow spot. The staff was cool and relaxed and very friendly ,the food was great and the portions were big and the food was good the next day too. I have no pix because I are that shit uuppppp ! It was a skillet . Yummy!

I came here on a whim with some friends. None of us were from Phoenix, we were in the area for a charity run and decided to have a real breakfast, not the hotel continental. And we got a real breakfast. I ordered a small stack and those pancakes were pretty big and fluffy. It was also super cheap. My friends were also very satisfied with their meals. Even with the semi large group, the food took almost no time to get to us and the service was friendly. The owner even came up to us to welcome us because she knew we were not regulars.

Far and away the restaurant I have frequented most often, 5th Avenue is superlative for service and food quality for the price. Other reviews describe it as a greasy spoon or good hangover food. Perhaps - but then if these folks were looking for cordon bleu, they were in the wrong place, weren't they. It's a breakfast/lucnh place, so compare it to Denny's or IHOP - with exponentially improved quality.  It's as healthy as you make it - you can order french toast, eggs, and bacon or an egg white omlette! They are awesome at accepting alterations on menu items. The only thing I ever ordered that I didn't like wa the Fiesta Omlette - chili beans over eggs. Not because it wasn't tasty - but it was just a weird combination that didn't work for me.  This morning, boyfriend and I went for breakfast. The cafe was busier than we've ever seen it - and, according to the owner, busier than he's ever seen it either! Absolutely love seeing local businesses thrive.  If you're ever in Central Phoenix near 7th Avenue and Thomas and need a bite for breakfast or lunch, 5th Avenue Cafe may really surprise you with their homey atmosphere, friendly service, good food, and low prices.

Everyone has their own rating scale. Mine has been what ever I thought at the moment. I need to change and be more consistent in my ratings. One, two and three stars do not need much explanation it will be evident in the review. Four stars is we had a good meal and I will consider eating there when I am in the area. Five stars? I am planning on going back as soon. I will make a special trip to go eat there. Even if I have to drive 20 or 30 miles to do it.  We had just got our taxes done. It was ab out 9:00am and we wanted breakfast. I did go to Yelp to find a place in the area and this place had some pretty good reviews. If you blink you will miss the building. I had to turn around and come back as I did miss it. Parking in front is limited. I do not know what is is back or street.  The theme is music. There are many pictures of music and musical instruments around the room. The room is laid out simple tables and booths. There were quite a few people eating there but the noise was quite. Everything looked clean and orderly. The food was good, but breakfast is hard to mess up. I had two eggs, bacon, sliced tomato instead of hash browns, and coffee. It was good. The beacon was nice thick slices, not the skinny stuff you get some places.  One of the big reasons for the 4 stars was the people that worked there. Everyone was very helpful and willing to substitute items on a listed menu meal. Some places are not or want to charge extra. Her attitude was whatever made you happy makes us happy. If I am in the area I will eat there again.

This place is pretty awesome.  It truly feels like the local hangout/diner that everyone wishes they had in their neighborhood.  It was really awesome to look around and see the wide range of clientele in here and it makes for some killer people watching while dining, my favorite.    The menu here isn't terribly inventive, but you shouldn't expect it to be.  I chose the Cowboy Scramble, or something similarly named, which was eggs, bacon, ham, cheese, and hash browns all scrambled together.  Literally, it was all scrambled, not just layered.  It wasn't the prettiest dish to behold, but it was pretty tasty, and I would definitely order it again.  It tasted fantastic and was incredibly filling.  I only got about halfway through it.  I will definitely come back here again.  Service is good, the location is good, the food is good, and best of all, they have a decent parking situation.  Yay!
